Photo by Gratisography

Yes, it’s a Sunday edition again this week, but whatever the day, This Week in Genesis there’s so much going on you might just need a second cup of coffee before you finish reading it.

So what’s happening?

Well, there’s the release of Genesis 2.4; three gorgeous theme teases; plus Brian Gardner chatting to the Genesis dream team that is Brian and Jennifer Bourn over at Bourn Creative.

—

Genesis 2.4

It seems like only yesterday Genesis 2.3 was here but – thanks to lot of great work from Gary Jones and Ron Rennick especially – Genesis 2.4 (actually, Genesis 2.4.1 thanks to a couple of minor fixes) is already out in the wild.

Genesis 2.4 for WordPress Now Available — https://t.co/2hth6DxPaX #genesiswp

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 28, 2016

I won’t repeat the entire release blog post but this version includes improvements to the Markup API; improvements to inline documentation and code standards; plus, a whole host of smaller enhancements and bug fixes.

#GenesisWP v2.4 for #WordPress Now Available https://t.co/eiQTMTAEDa pic.twitter.com/SCl96eXTC7

— Chuck Reynolds ? (@ChuckReynolds) September 28, 2016

And finally on the subject of Genesis 2.4, Gary Jones with your Genesis fact of the day…

Genesis 2.4.0 is the first major release to have fewer lines of comments than the previous release #genesiswp https://t.co/XXxzQpaRbb pic.twitter.com/jGBMl3dJli

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) September 29, 2016

Themes

Brian Gardner’s working on a new theme called Infinity Pro and it’s looking good.

Working on a new theme design —> https://t.co/GWemEeZJAz #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 21, 2016

There’s also a demo link (at least at the time of me writing this).

New theme demo for you to see for the next ten minutes —> https://t.co/1X4iFoDqhn #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 30, 2016

And he reveals it’ll support WooCommerce too.

New theme will support @WooCommerce — https://t.co/1YrbL1QC2t #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 30, 2016

And you can expect to see it soon on StudioPress!

@conradoconnell Probably be a few weeks before it’s available on StudioPress.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 30, 2016

And Brian’s not the only one that’s been teasing, JT Grauke has a couple of teases of a new Genesis theme, Gallery Pro…

Gallery Pro: a new #genesiswp theme in the works by @kelseygrauke and @jtgrauke: https://t.co/5ITnxccT0I

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) September 24, 2016

Gallery Portfolio Page https://t.co/kd11np22gP #genesiswp #ui #webdesign #website #minimal #photography #typography

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) September 28, 2016

…and Frank at WPStudio will also have you dribbbling with a tease of his next theme, Scope.

Another shot of my upcoming Genesis theme: https://t.co/NtCWjUPwHI #genesiswp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) September 27, 2016

Showcase

Great site from Nick Wilmot for jubileesolihull.org

Delighted to have just launched https://t.co/00TCFJ9MDF for the lovely folks @JubileeSolihull. #genesiswp #wordpress #church

— Nick Wilmot (@nickwilmot) September 29, 2016

Maira Gall for airesdebohemia.com.ar

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, a new #genesiswp site for https://t.co/qOzH3GhohA by @immairagall https://t.co/DDdVWGhnpX pic.twitter.com/rt6sukJHHZ

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) October 1, 2016

@eightcrazy with a twist on the Altitude Pro theme for gracechristianalaska.org

Been awhile since I put a site together, but here is one I just did for the GCS using the #genesiswp #altitudetheme https://t.co/wHSWoiXsJ0

— eightcrazy (@eightcrazy) October 1, 2016

Neil Gee for brettbarclay.com

New #GenesisWP https://t.co/5n98lv1xEw site launched on Rainmaker pic.twitter.com/Kg17OTexSf

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) September 29, 2016

Mike Hemberger for cctas.com

Launched https://t.co/LsMwsn8T8V with @SpearsMarketing this week. Another fun one with ACF/client editable front page content. #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/UCu1SXzhdv

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) September 28, 2016

Jackie D’Elia for freightci.com

Just launched a new client site https://t.co/X4zgkez29r #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/DC2cg5o5m5

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) September 28, 2016

Leslie Newman for eagereyes.org

@eagereyes Congrats! Glad I had a part in your site's 10yr bday present #genesisWP #loveaclientwithgreatcontent

— Leslie Newman (@Leslie_Newman) September 25, 2016

Dave Barr for therealmacbeth.com

Tweaking a favourite of mine; The Real Macbeth using Envy Pro from @KrolynStudios with #WordPress & #genesiswp https://t.co/5cconRBjaC

— Dave Barr (@barrd) September 25, 2016

Podcasts

The latest StudioPress.fm episode is out featuring Brian Gardner and chatting to Genesis community’s very own dream team, Brian and Jennifer Bourn of Bourn Creative, two smart people you can definitely learn from.

New episode on StudioPress FM: How to Sustain a Profitable Creative Agency — https://t.co/h3uTIfI3nv with @BournCreative pic.twitter.com/TtZE5OOAWk

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 28, 2016

Best of the rest

League WP has a tutorial on how to display manual excerpts below page titles in Genesis.

How to Display Manual Excerpts Below Page Titles in #GenesisWP Sample Theme#WordPress #codesnippets https://t.co/s2EJyqoquN

— League WP (@league_wp) September 27, 2016

Neil Gee on how to add a sticky footer to your Genesis theme with Flexbox.

Adding a Sticky Footer to #GenesisWP Theme with Flexbox https://t.co/YSzRpiUCwC

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) September 29, 2016

The fine folk over at UK Genesis released all of their internal docs relating to their podcast. If you’re thinking of starting your own show you might find them useful.

We've released our #ukgenesis podcast internal documentation under CC0:https://t.co/Cg5U85vjt5#genesiswp pic.twitter.com/785fVI6fD2

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) September 26, 2016

You may remember a while back I was talking about a new Genesis Blox Lite, well it’s now reached 1,000 active users.

Blox Lite has reached 1000 active users on https://t.co/qs9RH2frdZ. Thanks everyone! https://t.co/EkJ8FEeQXB #genesiswp

— Blox (@bloxwp) September 28, 2016

And finally…

It’s not (directly) Genesis related but if you’re a Genesis developer (or aspiring one) I’ve re-discovered and been enjoying 10up’s Engineering Best Practices this week.

Whether you’re a pro, learning the basics, or just need a refersher, there’s a lot of good stuff in there.

—

That’s all folks.

I’ll most likely be back with another edition Friday (or Saturday or Sunday) next week.

Until then, have a great week and let’s keep Genesis awesome.

PS If you find this update useful I’d love it if you subscribed below. You’ll get one (very occasionally two) emails a week and your life will be even better than it is already.
